column1: The city was founded by Governor Justo Daract on or around December 1
column5: to protect the territory against attacks by the Ranquel aboriginal tribes. The original name was changed in 1861 to Villa Mercedes by decision of the residents
column6: who had adopted the Virgin of Mercy (Virgen de las Mercedes) as their patron.

column1: Villa Mercedes grew quickly after a railway line from Villa María on the Central Argentine line between Rosario and Córdoba
column2: reached the town in  1875.   Built by the State-owned company Ferrocarril Andino
column3: the line was extended to San Juan in 1885 via San Luis and Mendoza.  The line from Villa Mercedes to Mendoza would become the middle section of the route from Buenos Aires and was bought by the Argentine Great Western Railway in 1887 and later became part of the Buenos Aires and Pacific Railway network.

column1: Villa Mercedes was officially declared a city in 1896. It is now the second largest in San Luis
column2: and an industrial and educational center
column3: hosting a branch of the National University of San Luis.
